sen.j: 高 重茂（こう しげもち、生年不詳 - 正平 (日本)23年/応安元年（1368年）？）は、南北朝時代 (日本)の武将。
sen.e: Shigemochi KO (year of birth unknown - 1368?) was a busho (Japanese military commander) in the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan).
Shigemochi KO (year of birth unknown - 1368?) was a busho (Japanese military commander) lived in the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan).
Shigemochi KO (year of birth unknown - 1368?) was a busho (Japanese military commander) lived in the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan).

sen.j: 本姓は高階氏。
sen.e: His main name was the Takashina clan.
His real family name was Takashina.
sen.cmt: 本姓を用語集に基づいて訂正しました。
sen.e: His real family name was Takashina.

sen.j: 高師重の子（異説として、高師茂の子とも）。
sen.e: Son of KO no Moroshige (as a heresy, son of KO no Moroshige (same name but a different chinese character used for Moro"shige"))
sen.cmt: 師重、師茂と同じ読みのようでしたので、カッコ内注釈をいれました。
sen.e: He was the son of KO no Moroshige (another theory suggests that his father was a different people with the same name).
sen.cmt: 文が不完全です。()内は同名別人の方がわかりやすいのではと考えました。
sen.e: He was the son of KO no Moroshige (another theory suggests that his father was a different people with the same name).

sen.j: 高師直と高師泰の弟に当たる。
sen.e: Younger brother of KO no Moronao and KO no Moroyasu
He was a younger brother of KO no Moronao and KO no Moroyasu
He was a younger brother of KO no Moronao and KO no Moroyasu

sen.j: 官位は駿河国守。
sen.e: His official rank was Governor of Suruga Province.
His official rank was the governor of Suruga Province.
sen.cmt: 駿河国守を単語調査に従いk記載訂正しました。
sen.e: His official rank was the governor of Suruga Province.

sen.j: 大和国権守。
sen.e: Gon no kami (provisional governor) of the Province of Yamato
He was the provisional governor of Yamato Province.
He was the provisional governor of Yamato Province.

sen.j: 兄達と共に足利尊氏に仕えて、1335年から始まる新田義貞との戦いにおいて武功を挙げた。
sen.e: He worked for his elder brothers and Takauji ASHIKAGA and achieved military exploits in the war against Yoshisada Nitta that began in 1335.
Serving Takauji ASHIKAGA with his elder brothers, he rendered distinguished military service in the battle against Yoshisada NITTA started in 1335.
sen.cmt: 原文と訳文の意味が一致しません。新田義貞の名字が大文字になっていません。
sen.e: Serving Takauji ASHIKAGA with his elder brothers, he rendered distinguished military service in the battle against Yoshisada NITTA started in 1335.

sen.j: その後も尊氏の九州落ちにも従った。
sen.e: After that, along with the drift to Kyusyu of Takauji, he fought in the Battle of Tatarahama with Taketoshi KIKUCHI and achieved military success.
He followed Takauji when Takauji made an escape to Kyusyu region afterward.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。原文と訳文の意味が一致しません。
sen.e: He followed Takauji when Takauji made an escape to Kyusyu region afterward.

sen.j: 多々良浜の戦いで菊池武敏とも戦い、武功を挙げている。
sen.e: He and his troops combated with the troops commanded by Taketoshi KIKUCHI in the battle of Tatarahama, and he performed military exploits.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。原文にそって書き換えました。
sen.e: He and his troops combated with the troops commanded by Taketoshi KIKUCHI in the battle of Tatarahama, and he performed military exploits.

sen.j: この時のエピソードとして、尊氏は「敗れた菊池軍の捕虜が信用できない」として一部を殺害しようとしたが、重茂は「寛大な処置を示すためにも、信用して殺害をやめるべきである」と尊氏に進言して、多くの捕虜を救ったと言われている。
sen.e: As an episode in this battle, it is said that when Takauji attempted to kill some of the captives of the defeated Kikuchi army since he could not trust them, Shigemochi told Takauji that he should trust them and stop kill them to show clemency and saved many captives.

There is an episode in the battle that when Takauji attempted to kill some of the captive soldiers belonging to the defeated Kikuchi troops on the pretext that he could not trust them, Shigemochi saved many captives by making a recommendation to Takauji, saying 'To show clemency, you should refrain from executing them by putting trust in them.'
sen.cmt: 多少わかりづらいので書き換えました。
sen.e: There is an episode in the battle that when Takauji attempted to kill some of the captive soldiers belonging to the defeated Kikuchi troops on the pretext that he could not trust them, Shigemochi saved many captives by making a recommendation to Takauji, saying 'To show clemency, you should refrain from executing them by putting trust in them.'

sen.j: その後も京都における戦いなどで武功を挙げたため、1337年に武蔵国守護に任じられた。
sen.e: After that since he achieved military success in the battles in Kyoto, he was appointed Governor of Musashi Province in 1337 and also achieved success in the battle with Akiie KITABATAKE in 1338.
He was appointed to the governor of Musashi Province in 1337 because he performed various military exploits in the battles in Kyoto and other places afterward.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。「京都における戦いなど」のニュアンスを出すために書き換えました。
sen.e: He was appointed to the governor of Musashi Province in 1337 because he performed various military exploits in the battles in Kyoto and other places afterward.

sen.j: 1338年にも北畠顕家との戦いで功績を挙げた。
sen.e: He also rendered distinguished military service in the battle with Akiie KITABATAKE in 1338.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: He also rendered distinguished military service in the battle with Akiie KITABATAKE in 1338.

sen.j: その後は尊氏の天竜寺建立に尽力した。
sen.e: He worked hard to establish Tenryu-ji Temple for Takauji.
He worked hard in the project to establish Tenryu-ji Temple drawn up by Takauji.
He worked hard in the project to establish Tenryu-ji Temple drawn up by Takauji.

sen.j: また、尊氏の弟・足利直義の与力となって所領訴訟に関する奉行などを務めている。
sen.e: He also became a yoriki (a police sergeant) of Naoyoshi ASHIKAGA, the younger brother of Takauji and worked as a bugyo (a magistrate) and handled court cases about territory.
Also being appointed to the yoriki (a police sergeant) serving Naoyoshi ASHIKAGA, the younger brother of Takauji, he dealt with suits related to territory as a bugyo (a magistrate).
sen.cmt: 多少わかりづらいので書き換えました。
sen.e: Also being appointed to the yoriki (a police sergeant) serving Naoyoshi ASHIKAGA, the younger brother of Takauji, he dealt with suits related to territory as a bugyo (a magistrate).

sen.j: 1343年に駿河守に叙任した。
sen.e: In 1343, he was appointed Governor of Suruga Province.
In 1343, he was appointed to the governor of Suruga Province.
In 1343, he was appointed to the governor of Suruga Province.

sen.j: 翌年からは関東の執政を務めている。
sen.e: From the next year, he worked as an administrative ruler in Kanto.
From the next year, he worked as an administrative ruler in Kanto.
From the next year, he worked as an administrative ruler in Kanto.

sen.j: 観応の擾乱での、重茂の詳しい動きは不明であるが、重茂は直義と親しい仲にあったことから、直義に与していたのではないかと推測される。
sen.e: The detailed movement of Shigemochi in the Kano Disturbance is unknown, but since Shigemochi had a close relationship with Naoyoshi, it is assumed that he might have involved in this disturbance.
The details of Shigemochi in the Kano Disturbance are unknown, but since Shigemochi had a close relationship with Naoyoshi, it is assumed that he may have taken Naoyoshi's side.
sen.cmt: 与するを正確に訳する必要があると思われます。過去の推量なのでmayに訂正しました。詳しい動きは詳細でよいと思われます。
sen.e: The details of Shigemochi in the Kano Disturbance are unknown, but since Shigemochi had a close relationship with Naoyoshi, it is assumed that he may have taken Naoyoshi's side.

sen.j: ちなみに高氏の多くがこの乱で殺害されているのに対し、重茂は生き延びており、以後は鎌倉公方・足利基氏の家臣として仕えているのである。
sen.e: Although many members of the Ko clan was killed in this disturbance, Shigemochi survived, and after that he worked as a vassal of quasi-Shogun Motouji ASHIKAGA.

By the way, Shigemochi survived this disturbance although many members of the Ko clan were killed, serving Kamakura kubo (Governor-general of the Kanto region), quasi-Shogun Motouji ASHIKAGA as a vassal afterward.
sen.cmt: 「ちなみに」と「鎌倉公方」が訳抜けです。
sen.e: By the way, Shigemochi survived this disturbance although many members of the Ko clan were killed, serving Kamakura kubo (Governor-general of the Kanto region), quasi-Shogun Motouji ASHIKAGA as a vassal afterward.

sen.j: 1368年、武蔵国で宇都宮氏らが首謀した鎌倉府への反乱が起こった際に、重茂もこの反乱に与していたと言われている。
sen.e: In 1368, when the rebellion against Kamakura Government which was led by the Utsunomiya clan occurred in Musashi Province, it is said that Shigemochi was involved in this rebellion.
Shigemochi is believed to have been a conspirator of the rebellion against Kamakura Government instigated by the Utsunomiya clan, which occurred in Musashi Province in 1368.
sen.cmt: 多少わかりづらいので書き換えました。
sen.e: Shigemochi is believed to have been a conspirator of the rebellion against Kamakura Government instigated by the Utsunomiya clan, which occurred in Musashi Province in 1368.

sen.j: 反乱は9月に鎮圧されたが、このときに重茂は死亡したと言われている。
sen.e: The rebellion was quashed in September, in which it is said that Shigemochi was killed.
While the rebellion was quashed in September of the same year, Shigemochi was killed in the rebellion, a theory suggests.
sen.cmt: 多少わかりづらいので書き換えました。
sen.e: While the rebellion was quashed in September of the same year, Shigemochi was killed in the rebellion, a theory suggests.

sen.j: 生存説もあるが、この反乱の後の重茂の消息は不明である。
sen.e: Although there is an opinion that he survived, after this rebellion, his whereabouts are unknown.
Another theory suggests that he survived the rebellion, but nothing has been heard of him since then.
sen.cmt: 所在と消息は異なると考え訳し直しました。
sen.e: Another theory suggests that he survived the rebellion, but nothing has been heard of him since then.
